@UrbanEducation I agree.Poverty prevents that from happening though. Socioeconomic divides are working against our kids in a big way.
I am hopeful that we can take politics OUT of education once and for all and allow educators to do what they do best....teach.
Somewhere along the way we have forgotten that we are educating children, not miniature adults.Current programs are sorely lacking.
@educationweek not really surprised by this given the inequities that currently exist in our eduation systems.  I hope they are realistic.
@UrbanEducation yes; I think we DO pander to the masses and that's where most of the problems stem from.  Education needs an overhaul.
@UrbanEducation suburban teachers can get complacent because parents of those students will do whatever it takes to get them the help needed
